gurmukhi: ਮੁਖ ਤੰਬੋਰ ਅਰੁ ਰੰਗ ਸੁਰੰਗੰ ॥ ਨਿਡਰ ਭ੍ਰਮੰਤ ਭੂੰਮਿ ੳੁਹ ਜੰਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Moukh Tanbor Ar(u) Ran Suranadg|| Nidar Bhramannd Bhoonm(i) Uh Janadg||
translation: There is betel in the mouth of Ravana an the colour of his body is red, he is moving fearlessly in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: ਲਿਪਤ ਮਲੈ ਘਨਸਾਰ ਸੁਰੰਗੰ ॥ ਰੂਪ ਭਾਨ ਗਤਿਵਾਨ ੳੁਤੰਗੰ ॥੬੦੦॥
transliteration: Lipat Malai Ghansaar Suranadg|| Roop Bhaan Gadivaan Outanadg||600||
translation: He has plastered his body with sandalwood; he is bright like the sun and is moving with a superior gait.600.

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਸੁਭਤ ਸੁਰੰਗੰ ਛਬਿ ਅੰਗ ਅੰਗੰ ਲਜਤ ਅਨੰਗੰ ਲਖ ਨੈਣੰ ॥ ਸੋਭਿਤ ਕਚਕਾਰੇ ਅਤ ਘੁੰਘਰਾਰੇ ਰਸਨ ਰਸਾਰੇ ਮ੍ਰਿਦ ਬੈਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Tan Soubhat Suranadg Chhab(i) An Anadg Lajat Ananadg Lakh Nainan|| Sobhit Kachkdare At Ghounghrdare Rasan Rasdare Mrid Bainan||
translation: Seeing his winsome body and elegant limbs, the god of love is feeling shy, he has back curly hair and sweet speech;

gurmukhi: ਮੁਖਿ ਛਕਤ ਸੁਬਾਸੰ ਦਿਨਸ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸੰ ਜਨੁ ਸਸ ਭਾਸੰ ਤਸ ਸੋਭੰ ॥ ਰੀਝਤ ਚਖ ਚਾਰੰ ਸੁਰਪੁਰ ਪਯਾਰੰ ਦੇਵ ਦਿਵਾਰੰ ਲਖਿ ਲੋਭੰ ॥੬੦੧॥
transliteration: Moukh(i) Chhakat Soubaasan Dinas Prakaasan Jan(u) Sas Bhaasan Tas Sobhan|| Reejhat Chakh Chaaran Surpur Pyaaran Dev Devaaran Lakh(i) Lobhan||601||
translation: His face is fragranted and appears shining like sun and glorifying like moon. On seeing him all feel delighted and the people of the abode of gods also do not hesitate to see him.601.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ੍ਹਾਸ ੲੇਕੰ ਕਰ ਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਦੁਤੀਅਾ ਧੋਪੁ ਗਹਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਤੀ ਕਟਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Channdrahaas Ekan Kar Dhdaree|| Douteeaa Dhop(u) Gad(i) Tritikatdaree||
translation: In one of his hands there was the sword named Chandrahaas, in the second hand was another arm named Dhop and in the third hand there was spear;

gurmukhi: ਚਤ੍ਰਥ ਹਾਥ ਸੈਹਥੀ ੳੁਜਿਅਾਰੀ ॥ ਗੋਫਨ ਗੁਰਜ ਕਰਤ ਚਮਕਾਰੀ ॥੬੦੨॥
transliteration: Chatrath Haath Saihathiujidaree|| Gophan Guraj Karat Chamkdaree||602||
translation: In his fourth hand there was a weapons named Saihathi having sharp glimmer, in his fifth hand and sixth hand there was a glittering mace and a weapon named Gophan.602.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੲੇ ਅਸ ਭਾਰੀ ਗਦਹਿ ੳੁਭਾਰੀ ਤ੍ਰਿਸੂਲ ਸੁਧਾਰੀ ਛੁਰਕਾਰੀ ॥ ਜੰਬੂਵਾ ਅਰ ਬਾਨੰ ਸੁ ਕਸਿ ਕਮਾਨੰ ਚਰਮ ਅਪ੍ਰਮਾਨੰ ਧਰ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Satae As Bhaarigadah(i) Ouchaaritrisool Sudhaarichhurkdaree|| Janboovaa Ar Baanan Su Kas(i) Kamaanan Charam Apramaanan Dhar Bhdaree||
translation: In his seventh hand there was another heavy and swollen mace and in other hands there were trident, pincers, arrows, bow etc. as weapons and arms.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਦ੍ਰੲੇ ਗਲੋਲੰ ਪਾਸ ਅਮੋਲੰ ਪਰਸ ਅਡੋਲੰ ਹਥਿ ਨਾਲੰ ॥ ਬਿਛੂਅਾ ਪਹਰਾਯੰ ਪਟਾ ਭ੍ਰਮਾਯੰ ਜਿਮ ਜਮ ਧਾਯੰ ਬਿਕਰਾਲੰ ॥੬੦੩॥
transliteration: Pandrae Gadolan Paas Amolan Paras Adolan Hath(i) Naalan Bichhodhaa Pahraayan Pataa Bhramaayan Jim Jam Dhaayan Bikraalan||||603||
translation: In his fifteenth hand there were an arm-like pellet bow and weapons named Pharsa. He had worn in his hands steel-hooked weapons shaped like tiger’s claws and he was roaming like dreadful Yama.603.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਿਵ ਸਿਵ ਮੁਖ ੲੇਕ ੳੁਚਾਰੰ ॥ ਦੁਤੀਅ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ਜਾਨਕੀ ਨਿਹਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Siv Siv Siv Moukh Ek Ouchaaran|| Douteea Prabhaa Jaanakinihaaran||
translation: He was repeating the name of Shiva from one face, from the second he was looking at the beauty of Sita;
